thread.title: 'Top Chef' season 13 gets December 2015 premiere date for new California season
thread.title_full: 'Top Chef' season 13 gets December 2015 premiere date for new California season | Examiner.com

author: Hector Cruz
title: 'Top Chef' season 13 gets December 2015 premiere date for new California season
text:
(L-R) Hosts Padma Lakshmi, Tom Colicchio and Gail Simmons, winners of the Reality - Competition Program Award for 'Top Chef' pose in the press room at the 62nd Annual Primetime Emmy Awards held at the JW Marriott Los Angeles at L.A. Live. Photo by Jason Merritt/Getty Images Bravo announced on Monday, Oct. 19 the premiere date for ' Top Chef " season 13. The new season will launch with a two-night premiere on Wednesday, Dec. 2 and Thursday, Dec. 3, Variety reports. The long-running reality competition series will be hitting the road for its 13th season, traveling across California for the show's first multi-city tour, with stops in Los Angeles, San Diego, Santa Barbara, Oakland, the Greater Palm Springs area and San Francisco, where the series first began back in 2006.
A preview for the new season teases the return of the Sudden Death Quickfire challenge, while elimination challenges will include an episode cooking on a golf course, catering “the ultimate gay wedding” and a plating challenge where the chefs’ fate will be determined by Instagram fans. The contestants will also serve food to MC Hammer on the Oakland waterfront and Chrissy Teigen in Palm Springs. According to People , two things contestants will cook with this season are Bugles and Spam.
The contestants include New York City-based Grayson Schmitz, who competed on the show back in season 9. The rest of the chefs include: Karen Akunowicz, Boston; Angelina Bastidas, Miami; Carl Dooley, Boston; Garret Flemming, Washington, D.C.; Jeremy Ford, Miami; Renee Kelly, Shawnee Mision, KS; Phillip Frankland Lee, Los Angeles; Marjorie Meek-Bradley,Washington, D.C.; Kwame Onwuachi, Washington, D.C.; Amar Santana, Orange County, CA; Jason Stratton, Seattle; Frances Tariga-Weshnak, New York City; Isaac Toups, New Orleans; Wesley True, Atlanta; Giselle Wellman, Los Angeles; and Chad White, San Diego, CA and Tijuana, Mexico
Host Padma Lakshmi and head judge Tom Colicchio are returning alongside judges Gail Simmons , Richard Blais and Emeril Lagasse. Eater reports that the season will feature special appearances by Hugh Acheson, Max Silvestri, Ludo Lefebvre, Michael Cimarusti, José Andrés, John Besh, Art Smith, Javier Plascencia, Michael Voltaggio, Jacques LaMerde, Bill Chait, Jonathan Waxman, Martin Yan, Adam Fleischman, Traci Des Jardins, Hubert Keller, Antonia Lofaso and Dana Cowin. After the two-night premiere, “Top Chef” season 13 will air regularly on Thursday nights at 10/9 p.m. CT on Bravo.
